title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Governance
content:
Wise is one the fastest growing companies in Europe and weâ€™re on a mission: to make money without borders the new normal. Weâ€™ve got 16 million customers across the globe and weâ€™re growing. Fast.
Current banking systems donâ€™t let us send, spend or receive money across borders easily. Or quickly. Or cheaply. 
So, weâ€™re building a new one.
We need a Senior Software Engineer to join our mission and help us build a global platform thatâ€™s scalable, reliable and secure. Youâ€™ll dive right into projects on data governance core systems and internal tooling.
About the role 
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with a data security and privacy mindset to join our Data Governance team.
It is imperative that we protect our customersâ€™ money and data. In addition, there are many interesting challenges when it comes to meeting regulatory requirements world-wide. As a Senior Software Engineer in the wider Platform tribe and Engineering organisation, you will have an opportunity to directly affect data governance engineering strategy, building production systems ensuring we have strong and effective data governance controls in place, to detect and mitigate risks across our systems.
Data Governance team develops and operates Wiseâ€™s data governance systems and tooling integrations with the numerous data technologies and services powering the Wise mission.
How we work
We operate on a strong belief in automation, programmatic implementation, and reusable design. Weâ€™re looking for people who can step back and think holistically about the ecosystem, but also follow through and help implement the design; drawing on the resources across the rest of the platform tribe.
As we grow, our services architecture and data ecosystems get more complex. We need to sustain this growth by ensuring automated controls, with a focus on availability, security, and ease of use. Weâ€™re looking for an engineer with relevant experience who can analyse complex requirements and deliver simple solutions to help our teams achieve our mission with speed and confidence. 
As we scale we continue to push our teams to run autonomously. They are closest to our customers, so theyâ€™re empowered to decide what to prioritise and deliver, without being told what to do by leadership. This means they can move fast and run multiple projects at the same time.
At Wise we split our time between the office and home focusing on using the most appropriate place for our activities. Think about coming together in person for events which focus on coaching, community and collaboration.
What will you be working on?
Work closely with our Platform, Security and Privacy teams to ensure Wiseâ€™s data processing systems conform to security best practices and our policies
Architect, design and implement reliable data governance services and tooling
Help protect customer data and meet regulatory requirements worldwide
Contribute to our mission of building secure data systems and flows powering the rails for global finance that customers can trust
 
What do you need?
Solid experience as a full-stack or backend engineer during which you developed skills in technologies like Spring boot, Docker, AWS, REST APIs (frontend skills is a big plus)
Experience running large stateful data systems and production services in the cloud (AWS preferred)
Strong fundamentals in distributed systems design and development
Proficiency in one or more programming languages (Java, Scala, Python) (JVM based language essential)
A good understanding of relational databases, big data, and stream processing technologies (e.g. Kafka, S3, Flink, Snowflake)
Experience with enterprise data catalogue/governance systems or eagerness to master them is preferable
Mastery of fundamental software engineering practices like good design documentation, unit testing, peer code reviews, and a preference for agile methods
Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and organisational skills to communicate effectively new processes and workflows, and interact with teams from different areas of the organisation
Ability to assess risk and impact to the business and individuals from a privacy and data protection perspective
You get back
The ability to choose your own path to success â€“ youâ€™ll have the freedom to define the vision 
The freedom to have real impact
The opportunity to inspire teams 
A fun work environment with social activities and events

Flexible working â€“ whether itâ€™s working from home, school plays or life admin we get that flexibility is essential and youâ€™re trusted to do the right thing and be responsible

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
